title: Forensic Science and Law Enforcement Basics: Blended Learning-Based Mathematical Applications Course

context.additional_context: A blended learning program applying mathematical analysis to forensic evidence interpretation and criminal investigation, combining online theoretical learning with LMS-based virtual simulations

learning_goals: Solve probability problems occurring in forensic science settings using Bayesian statistical models
Build and interpret least-squares regression models for criminal investigation data analysis
Analyze temporal/spatial patterns of digital evidence via matrix operations and apply findings to visualization reports
Quantify errors in forensic science experimental data using standard deviation and confidence interval concepts
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
